Title.evidence: Methods: This was a cost‐effectiveness analysis of the DIVA arm of the multicentre randomized Ladies trial

Participants.evidence: comparing primary anastomosis over Hartmann's procedure for Hinchey grade III or IV diverticulitis

Intervention.evidence: comparing primary anastomosis over Hartmann's procedure

Objective.evidence: The present study aimed to evaluate costs and cost‐effectiveness within the DIVA arm of the Ladies trial.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Main outcomes were incremental cost‐effectiveness (ICER) and cost–utility (ICUR) ratios, expressed as the ratio of incremental costs and the incremental probability of being stoma‐free or incremental quality‐adjusted life‐years respectively.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Overall, 130 patients were included, of whom 64 were allocated to primary anastomosis and 66 to Hartmann's procedure.

Number_Analysed.evidence: analysed according to the modified intention‐to‐treat principle

Result_Outcome.evidence: Overall mean costs per patient were lower for primary anastomosis (€20 544, 95 per cent c.i. 19 569 to 21 519) than Hartmann's procedure (€28 670, 26 636 to 30 704), with a mean difference of €–8126 (–14 660 to –1592).
